creator: pb@bieringer.de
text:
If possible, pls. add a (optional) config directive for suexec_log. Would be
nice for use e.g. with cronolog. Currently, it's some kind of hardwired
configured via the configure run.

Thanks,
 Peter

Since the file is opened as root, it would be a big security hole.

But what has suexec to do with cronolog? If you want to change the uid of the
cronolog processes, just use one of the patches that are available from the
cronolog site.

Thanks for using Apache.
creator: nd@perlig.de
pb@bieringer.de
text:
I want to setup an automagically monthly split of this file.
Generally, because of still missing (but really requested) internal support of
date tokens in specifying log files I use for all the other logs currently cronolog.

But because there is no config directive for the suexec_log, I cannot setup such
log pipe into cronolog.

BTW: best would be full internal support, e.g.

SuExecLog    /var/log/httpd/suexec_log.%Y%m

I do not really like date splitting as an job done by other programs.

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
Duh, I've misunderstood your report slightly. But it still won't be done for
security reasons. The whole suexec config is compiled in and this won't be changed.
Since the file is opened at every suexec call, you can safely setup a logrotate
program (perhaps cronosplit, I'm not sure if it can parse the format).

Sorry.
